description: A shell script for setting up and managing a MySQL database server, including starting the server, configuring users, initializing the database, and applying schema updates.

methods.name: set -euo pipefail
methods.description: Enables strict error handling in bash script.

methods.name: echo
methods.description: Outputs information or status messages to the console.

methods.name: if sudo mysqladmin ping
methods.description: Checks if MySQL server is running on the default socket.

methods.name: if sudo mysql --socket=... -e "USE ${DB_NAME};"
methods.description: Verifies if the specific database exists and is accessible.

methods.name: if [ -f "${SCHEMA_FILE}" ]
methods.description: Checks if the schema.sql file exists for applying the schema.

methods.name: sudo mysql --socket=... < schema.sql
methods.description: Applies the database schema from schema.sql via socket connection.

methods.name: mysql -u root -p${DB_PASSWORD} -h 127.0.0.1 -P ${DB_PORT} ${DB_NAME} < schema.sql
methods.description: Applies schema.sql via TCP fallback if socket method fails.

methods.name: sudo mysql --socket=... << EOF ... EOF
methods.description: Configuration commands for setting up users, privileges, and fixing authentication for MySQL 8.0.

methods.name: sha256sum schema.sql
methods.description: Computes checksum of schema.sql to detect changes and avoid unnecessary reapplication.

methods.name: source db_visualizer/mysql.env
methods.description: Outputs environment variables for database connection.
